description.en: During the course the students get an overview on the etiology and mechanisms of development of basic syndromes and diseases at the level of organism, tissue, cell, and molecules as well as on the effects of pathogenic changes on the functions of organism.
description.et: Kursuses käsitletakse põhiliste sündroomide ja haiguste etioloogiat ja arengumehhanisme organismi, koe, raku ja molekulide tasandil ning haiguslike muutuste toimet organismi funktsioonidele.

objectives.en: The aim of the course is to provide the students with the basic knowledge on pathophysiology, useful to understand the etiology and pathogenesis of diseases and to use this knowledge for diagnosis and treatment of diseases.
objectives.et: Aine eesmärgiks on anda üliõpilastele patoloogilise füsioloogia alaseid algteadmisi, mis aitaksid mõista haiguste etioloogiat ja patogeneesi mehhanisme nüüdisaegsel tasemel ja osata kasutada neid teadmisi haiguste diagnoosimisel ja ravis.

learning_outcomes.en: The student who graduated the course:
- Can explain changes in functions of human organ systems in the pathological processes and most common diseases both at the cell and at the level of the organism,
learning_outcomes.et: - oskab selgitada inimese elundsüsteemide funktsioonide muutusi patoloogiliste protsesside ja enamlevinud haiguste korral nii raku kui ka organismi tasemel,

learning_outcomes.en: - knows the mechanisms of development of disturbances caused by harmful factors,
learning_outcomes.et: - teab kahjustavate faktorite poolt põhjustatud häirete arengumehhanisme,

learning_outcomes.en: - knows and analyzes the main regulatory mechanisms that ensure the stability of the indoor environment
learning_outcomes.et: - tunneb ja analüüsib põhilisi regulatoorseid mehhanisme, mis tagavad sisekeskkonna püsivuse.

independent_work.et: Grading the report-like talks (Ref) we will consider the content of talk, watchfulness, presentation materials and skills and ability of a student to answer to questions of other students and tutor. The 5-10 pp written text of talk is also the object of grading.

description.et:
Large written tests consist of essay type questions.
Simple tests use multiple choice answers or questions requiring succinct answers.
Answers are graded separately and then summarized. According to the total points the student gets result from A to F:
A 93-100%
B 85-92% 
C 77-84% 
D 69-76% 
E 60-68% 
F 0-59.4%

Essay and presentation
Both must be prepared and according to instructions (see separate file).
Presentation must be concise, easy to follow, well-illustrated and speaker must be able to give coherent answers. The essay must be a concise distillate of the article, use of additional references is highly recommended.

grade_preconditions.et:
1) At least 90% of practical works and seminars have to be done to be allowed to take the final exam. All large written tests have been done with a positive result (at least E). The short tests and essay are done.
2) If the quantity of missed seminar and practical works are in the range of 75-90% the student has to contact the supervisor of seminar and either prepare essay(s) on relevant topic(s) or to remake practical work(s) according schedule proposed by department.
3) If the participation has been less than 75 % one has to retake the course.

grade_evaluation.et:
The students have an opportunity to get an examination mark based on cumulative performance if:
- The student passes all of the big tests on time (with a result of at least 60%)
- The student passes all of the small tests and the essay presentation with a positive grade (at least 60%).
- The student has participated in the practical and seminar works as described above.

If the above conditions are met, the final grade consists of the following:
60% - the results of the big tests
20% - the result of short tests
20% - the result of the essay/ presentation

If you have to take the exam (written or oral), the final grade consists of the following:
60% - the result of the exam
20% - the result of the big tests
10% - the result of short tests
10% - the result of the essay/presentation

Grading system:
60% - 68% - E
69% - 76% - D
77% - 84% - C
85% - 92% - B
93% - 100% - A

debt_elimination.et:
1) The options to remake big tests and short tests are during 2 weeks after the scheduled time according to the timing proposed by the department.
2) Backlogs in seminar work may be liquidated by presentation of an essay to the supervisor of the seminar (agree upon the topic with the supervisor)
3) All backlogs have to be done before the final exam.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)
